subject: Investing
title: Vacancy Rates and How to Survive Them
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Vacancy Rates and How to Survive Them.

hook.text: An investor planned for zero vacancy. Two months later the unit sat empty and bills piled up.

buildup.text: Vacancy rate is the percentage of time a unit goes unrented. No rental stays full forever.

discovery.text: Healthy markets average 5â€“8% vacancy. College towns may spike every summer.

twist.text: Budgeting for 8% vacancy upfront turns a nasty surprise into a planned line item.

climax.text: Investors who budget for vacancy keep reserves intact and avoid forced sales.

punchline.text: Plan for empty months and they'll never threaten your bottom line.
